counties.name: Bexar
counties.demographicsBlurb: Large urban county centered on San Antonio; majority-Hispanic population, major military/healthcare employment base, and mixed urban-suburban jury pools. Education profile includes strong higher-ed pipeline with notable variation by ZIP and income corridor.
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: countywide voting has leaned Democratic in recent cycles, but margins vary significantly by precinct and judicial ballot type; benchmark presidential split is roughly D 58% / R 40%.

counties.name: Travis
counties.demographicsBlurb: Austin-centered county with strong tech/public-sector economy, younger median age profile, and one of Texas’s highest educational attainment rates. Jury pools can vary sharply between urban core and outlying precincts.
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: strongly Democratic in recent cycles; benchmark presidential split is roughly D 72% / R 27%, while select local judicial races can produce narrower deltas.

counties.name: Harris
counties.demographicsBlurb: Texas’s largest county with highly diverse population, heavy civil docket volume, and broad socioeconomic spread across urban, suburban, and industrial zones. Education levels are above state averages overall with sharp precinct-level differences.
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: countywide outcomes have leaned Democratic in recent cycles, with meaningful crossover dynamics in suburban areas; benchmark presidential split is roughly D 56% / R 43%.

courts.name: 55th District Court
courts.judgeProfileBlurb: Official Harris/Justex court roster lists Judge Latosha Lewis Payne for the 55th District Court.
courts.judgePoliticalBlurb: If included, derive only from verifiable public election disclosures.
courts.publicInfo: Official Justex API roster (`/JustexAPI/api/Courts/?CourtClassID=1`) resolves 55th District Court judge as Latosha Lewis Payne, floor 9, phone (832) 927-2650. Coordinator/bailiff fields remain pending because this endpoint does not expose staff contacts; keep staff verification queued for court-specific official pages. Dropbox/eFiling note: verify current county clerk or district clerk filing instructions.

courts.name: County Civil Court at Law No. 1
courts.publicInfo: Official staff page lists clerks Jesse Salas and Donna Hernandez, Trial Coordinator Melissa Hammond (832-927-1711), and Bailiff Deputy Willie Hughes (832-927-1701). Dropbox/eFiling note: verify current county clerk or district clerk filing instructions.

counties.name: Hidalgo
counties.demographicsBlurb: Border county with large Hispanic-majority population, high bilingual-service relevance, and significant cross-border economic influence. Education attainment is improving over time but still trails major Texas metro-county averages.
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: historically Democratic-leaning but increasingly competitive in statewide cycles; benchmark presidential split is roughly D 58% / R 41%.

counties.name: Dallas
counties.demographicsBlurb: Large metro county with high civil/commercial docket activity, substantial corporate-employer base, and diverse juror pools. Education attainment is relatively high overall, with concentration of graduate/professional populations in core submarkets.
counties.politicalBlurb: Election snapshot: countywide voting has leaned Democratic in recent cycles; benchmark presidential split is roughly D 65% / R 34%, with notable variation between urban core and outer precincts.
